result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane M Duckwitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Domestic Violence or Anger Management Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane M Duckwitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Shane M Duckwitz in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.



Court orders the following:
 50 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard releases).
STAYED.
  
Term of Probation:  9 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Domestic Violence or Anger Management Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent Contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Shane M Duckwitz in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to Appear, received and filed in court.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   
Defendant Shane M Duckwitz did not appear.
Attorney appeared by Authorization.  Hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Timothy F. Westphal and Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Shane M Duckwitz in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  
  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the witness listed in the criminal complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Shane M Duckwitz in court with attorney Samuel Benedict for attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
